Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2013 08:49AM LuvsLera wrote: Thank you for your responses, I am not sure exactly what chemo she is having, the info was pretty over whelming at the time.  She is triple negative which I know is pretty aggressive.  I will relay the info here and thank you again.  People just dont know how large of an epidemic this is.  Unreal.
Posts.Title: Ridding your body of Chemo LuvsLera LuvsLera

Posts.Content: LuvsLera wrote: Hi, I am new here but have found the info provided is very helpful and wish all on here the best of luck.  Cancer is something very foreign to me but it has now hit my wife and I am wanting to help as much as possible.  She has had successful surgery and will be starting chemo. next week.  I have read the tips thread and that was also very helpful.  I was wondering what are some good ways of ridding your body of the chemo as quickly as possible after treatments.  Also, quick tips to maybe help her out through this horrible time would be greatly appreciated.  I have thumbed through many pages and just didnt find what I was looking for.  Thank you all in advance, I look forward to hearing form you.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Ridding your body of Chemo LuvsLera LuvsLera
